remarks: Define the class abstraction (class builder) of a collection of nested ordered pairs (for use in defining operations).  This is a special case of Definition 4.16 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 14.  Normally ` x ` , ` y ` , and ` z ` are distinct, although the definition doesn't strictly require it.  See ~ df-ov for the value of an operation.  The brace notation is called "class abstraction" by Quine; it is also called a "class builder" in the literature.  The value of the most common operation class builder is given by ~ ovmpt2 .  (Contributed by NM, 12-Mar-1995.)
statement:
df-oprab $p |- { <. <. x , y >. , z >. | ph } = { w | E. x E. y E. z ( w = <. <. x , y >. , z >. /\ ph ) } $.
$d ph w $.
$d w x $.
$d w y $.
$d w z $.
